author: i5513
body:
Sometimes you need search a word starting from the end of the file (surely a log file) 

At Linux you can use standard tac command:

tac xxxx | filter | tac 

So you have the tail of the file filtered like you Want. The simple case is when filter is grep -m1 searchedword

I think Get-content could have -reverse option which would read the file from the finish

What do you think? See https://www.reddit.com/r/PowerShell/comments/dwuz96/large_csv_file/f7ma6g1?utm_medium=android_app&utm_source=share for a real example

Thank you!

comments.author: vexx32
comments.body:
@i5513 `Get-Content` can retrieve a specific number of lines from the end of the file with the `-Tail` parameter.

Is `tac` a different functionality to this, or the same thing here? 🙂

comments.author: SteveL-MSFT
comments.body: `tac` is a play `cat` but reversed.  It literally is `cat` but reverse.  Seems fine to have a new switch to allow similar capability.  I can see this being useful for logs that are in chronological order so you see the newest stuff first (could be used with `-Tail`, but not mutually exclusive).
